        public void run()

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Sets up a new connectFour object and sets up a game window

      • setGameMode

        public void setGameMode(int inputgameMode)
        A setter function for the game modes of the connectFour object pre: the given game mode is a valid representation of one of the four game modes
        post: the game mode has now been set to the given one
        Parameters:
        inputgameMode: - the int representation of the four different game modes: easy, medium, hard and human vs human

      • setBoardWidth

        public void setBoardWidth(int width)
        A function that sets the width of the board, should be called by the action listener when the number of columns is changed

        pre: the width given is in between the valid acceptable width
        post: the board width has been set to the given width

        Parameters:
        width: - the desired number of columns on the board

      • setBoardHeight

        public void setBoardHeight(int height)
        A function that sets the height of the board, should be called by the action listener when the number of rows is changed

        pre: the height given is in between the valid acceptable heights
        post: the board height has been set to the given height

        Parameters:
        height: - the desired number of rows on the board

      • initGame

        public void initGame(javax.swing.JFrame f)
        Responsible for the initialisation of the game by creating players, updating the user interface for gameplay and creating all backend objects needed for game simulation

        pre: the given JFrame is valid
        post: the game has been initialised with the given JFrame, the players have been set

        Parameters:
        f: - is the frame the game will be displayed in

      • startScreen

        public void startScreen(javax.swing.JFrame f)
        Responsible for constructing, setting out and showing all objects in the start screen

        pre: the given JFrame is valid
        post: the screen has been set to the starting screen

        Parameters:
        f: - the frame that the start screen will be shown in

      • setColumnButtons

        public void setColumnButtons()
        Responsible for making and setting out the buttons for each column of the connect four board

        pre: the frame has not been corrupted so far
        post: the column buttons have been set in the frame

      • setSidePanel

        public void setSidePanel()
        Responible for making and Laying out all attributes of the side panel present during game mode

        pre: the frame has not been corrupted so far
        post: the side panel has been populated with the appropriate buttons

      • humanPlayerMove

        public void humanPlayerMove(int column)
        Deals with human game moves. It will check the current player is a human before invoking the makeMove function within the HumanPlayer class

        pre: the column given is within the boundaries of the board
        post: the game has been updated to include the human players move

        Parameters:
        column - will be a number from 0 to 6 indicating the column the human player wants to drop a tile into

      • provideHint

        public void provideHint()
        A function which will ask the simulator to provide a hint for the human players next move

        pre: the game state is valid
        post: the simulator has been called to provie a hint to the player

      • undoSimulator

        public void undoSimulator()
        Undoes a move by resetting the Simulator to the old version

        pre: the game state is valid
        post: The game has reverted to the state it was in before the last human move, if no moves were yet made the game state has not changed, can also be called if a player has already won, or the game ended in a draw
